image.altText: A sign calling for information about the disappearance of Angie Fuller on the side of a road.

props.synopsis: Angie Fuller has been missing for three years. Police are offering an equal record reward for information into what they believe is a suspected outback murder.

title.children: A missing mother, the desolate desert and a $500k reward

image.altText: Floral tributes line a police station railing alongside the words: POLICE ONLY, NO UNAUTHORISED ENTRY

props.synopsis: A Sydney-based law firm says it is representing the family of a 44-year-old Aboriginal woman who died in custody at the Tennant Creek police watch house.

title.children: Aboriginal mother of five identified after death in NT police watch house

image.altText: two police officers walking down a deserted street from behind

props.synopsis: After years of negative headlines, crime rates in Alice Springs are showing signs of turning a corner but some locals remain worried the change could be short-lived.

title.children: Lower crime rates in Alice Springs leave many optimistic, others worried

image.altText: An outback landscape with a sign that reads Barrow Creek.

props.synopsis: The Barrow Creek Hotel was thrust into the global spotlight during the investigation into British backpacker Peter Falconio's disappearance. Now its liquor licence has been suspended for breaching Northern Territory licensing laws.

title.children: Remote pub at centre of Peter Falconio mystery has liquor licence suspended

image.altText: Children playing in a fountain at Parramatta Square during a heatwave.

props.synopsis: Southern Australia will collectively bake this week through the most intense spell of heat in years as temperatures soar up to 15 degrees Celsius above the mid-summer average.

title.children: Day-by-day guide to most severe southern Australia heatwave in years

image.altText: Prosura website, featuring a red banner saying they are responding to a cyber incident

props.synopsis: Australians who have rented cars have been caught up in a cyber incident affecting excess insurer Prosura, with customers receiving modified invoices from a self-proclaimed "threat actor".

title.children: Car excess insurer hit by cyber breach as 'threat actor' contacts customers

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: A strong overnight session on Wall Street is likely to support the ASX today ahead of the release of key inflation data. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street rallies on blue-chip strength, ASX set to rise ahead of key inflation data

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX set to rebound after strong sessions on Wall Street and in Europe, metals soar

image.altText: A still image from CCTV vision of seven boys dressed in jumpers and long pants walking along a footpath beside a waterway.

props.synopsis: Police are seeking help from the public to identify a group of teenagers wanted over what detectives have described as an ambush and machete attack in Caroline Springs, in Melbourne's west, last week.

title.children: Machete ambush after teenagers lured to park in Melbourne's west

image.altText: Red, green, blue and yellow glass along exterior of QVB

props.synopsis: Dozens of people have expressed opposition against a proposal to remove some of Queen Victoria Building's iconic coloured glass windows, after a development application stated they were not "fit for purpose in the eyes of global retail brands".

title.children: 'High volume' response after application for QVB windows to be made clear

image.altText: Steve Smith waves his bat towards the crowd, which applauds him in the background

props.synopsis: Steve Smith was at his bizarre best on day three in Sydney, grinding England into the dust with his scintillating strokeplay and trademark oddness.

title.children: Smith treats Sydney to a Smudge Day, in all its weird and wonderful glory

image.altText: A view of a coastal city with small houses and greenery with the water curving around the coast and mountains in the distance.

props.synopsis: Australians are among hundreds of tourists scrambling to leave a remote Yemeni island, as a crisis on the mainland between Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates causes travel chaos.

title.children: Australians trapped on Yemeni island after flare-up between Saudis and UAE

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, wearing a baseball cap and a polo shirt, speaks to a reporter just off camera.

props.synopsis: Whether or not Anthony Albanese believes a federal royal commission is necessary, or even the best use of resources, is now politically irrelevant.

title.children: Calls for a royal commission into Bondi an untenable political distraction

image.altText: Ajla Tomljanovic plays a backhand return at the 2025 Hong Kong Open.

props.synopsis: Australia's Ajla Tomljanović loses a tense three-set match to world number 20 Karolína Muchová, while Rinky Hijikata is the last remaining local hope in the men's draw.

title.children: Tomljanović departs Brisbane International as Hijikata advances

image.altText: Alex de Minaur of Team Australia playing with Storm Hunter of Team Australia celebrate their tennis victory.

props.synopsis: Twin wins from Alex de Minaur drags Australia off the canvas and into the United Cup quarterfinals with a do-or-die victory over Czechia.

title.children: De Minaur dazzles as Australia reaches United Cup quarterfinals

image.altText: A woman reads a book at a table stacked with more books inside a library

props.synopsis: The team at Adelaide's City of Marion Libraries grows a legion of fans on social media and sees their videos go viral, clocking up millions of views.

title.children: Videos made by SA librarians attract likes from Ariana Grande

image.altText: An echidna standing on some leaves

props.synopsis: The lack of knowledge about the species has experts worried echidnas could decline without anyone noticing.

title.children: Echidnas remain a mystery to scientists, but they need your help to change that

image.altText: A view of dead trees at sunset.

props.synopsis: From Tasmania to the Top End, Australia's forest trees are dying at higher rates due to climate change, according to new research.

title.children: As the world warms, more trees are dying in Australian forests

image.altText: Nationals Queensland senator Ron Boswell speaking in the Senate chamber at Parliament House in Canberra on February 27, 2013.

props.synopsis: Known as "Bozzie" to his mates and colleagues, Mr Boswell's political career spanned three decades.

title.children: Tributes flow for National Party stalwart after death at home

image.altText: Screens displaying the logo of Grok and its founder Elon Musk

props.synopsis: A digital undressing spree on Elon Musk's social media site has prompted investigations from countries including France, India and Malaysia.

title.children: EU, Britain condemn sexualised deepfake images spreading on X

image.altText: A woman sits on a bed. The bedspread is covered in images of her son.

props.synopsis: Ben Austin died after a cricket ball struck him in late October. For the first time his parents speak exclusively about the incident and their belief no one is to blame for the tragic accident.

title.children: 'It wasn't your fault': Ben Austin's parents offer support for other boy involved in cricket tragedy

image.altText: Stuart Clark and Todd Greenberg

props.synopsis: Stuart Clark opens up on his conversation with Cricket Australia chief Todd Greenberg after his stinging criticism.

title.children: Clark denies confrontation with CA boss after interview ban

image.altText: A girl sits on the floor hunched in a corner next to a cupboard, peering over her knees.

props.synopsis: Emails show staff working at Berry Street residential care homes may have been exposed to ice by children using drugs at its facilities.

title.children: Care workers say they are powerless to stop children using ice

image.altText: Heidelberg sinkhole

props.synopsis: The sudden collapse of a sinkhole in Melbourne's north-east left residents shocked on Tuesday. Here's an explanation of how and why they form.

title.children: Sinkholes could be forming for years before a sudden collapse. Here's why

image.altText: NSW Police Commissioner Mal Lanyon updates the media on Monday morning.

props.synopsis: The NSW police commissioner will extend temporary protest restrictions across Sydney for another two weeks.

title.children: Police commissioner extends protest restrictions in NSW

image.altText: A vehicle with a Happy Chanukah! sign that has sustained fire damage.

props.synopsis: A man is charged after an alleged arson attack on a vehicle with a Hanukkah decoration on Christmas morning in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man charged in connection to alleged Hanukkah car arson in Melbourne

image.altText: Livestock feed, fences and irrigation infrastructure destroyed in the fire.

props.synopsis: A southern NSW landholder is urging smokers to think twice when disposing of their cigarette butts, after a grassfire razed her property.

title.children: Drivers begged to stop being 'tossers' after fire sparked by cigarette

image.altText: Men in blue jackers that say 'police' on the back walk in front of a boarded off bar front.

props.synopsis: Swiss authorities admitted that fire safety inspections hadn't been carried out since 2019 at Crans-Montana bar where 40 people died on New Year's Eve.

title.children: Swiss bar missed years of fire safety inspections before deadly blaze

image.altText: An older woman teaches a younger woman how to knit

props.synopsis: In a country town near Canberra, a program run by an aged care provider and the local high school is seeing positive results in breaking down barriers between younger and older community members.

title.children: A 70-year age gap is no barrier to friendship in this town

image.altText: Two people stand atop sand dunes staring out over the ocean with binoculars, with tractors and boats on the beach below.

props.synopsis: Police confirm human remains have been found washed ashore north of Perth, believed to be those of a 32-year-old man missing since New Year's Day.

title.children: Human remains found in search for missing snorkeller in WA

image.altText: Firefighters in yellow protective gear using a hose along the ground in front of a bright orange glow from nearby flames

props.synopsis: Australia's capital cities are increasingly at risk of being affected by a major fire like the one that ravaged Los Angeles last year, according to a new climate report.

title.children: LA-like fires could hit Australian capital cities, report warns

image.altText: Father and daughter frontbench duo Monia and Damien Tudehope

props.synopsis: The opposition leader says she does not consider the gender breakdown of her shadow ministry, which has 16 men and 10 women.

title.children: Father and daughter to sit on NSW opposition frontbench

image.altText: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. gestures as he speaks during the inaugural Make America Healthy Again summit in Washington in 2025.

props.synopsis: The US government takes the unprecedented step of cutting the number of vaccines it recommends for every child, a move long sought by Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr. But medical groups say it undermines protections against diseases.

title.children: Doctors slam US cut to vaccines recommended for children

image.altText: Mickey Rourke at a red carpet event in a hoodie and sunglasses, The Lincoln Moor Company

props.synopsis: The actor, who faced accusations of homophobia and inappropriate behaviour on set last year, could now lose his home.

title.children: Mickey Rourke launches fundraiser to pay $89,000 in rent
